result.execSummary:
The defendant Jason A. Olrich was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Deliver Cocaine (>5-15g), a class E felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(cm)2.
  • Felon Possess Firearm, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 941.29(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with Ct.6 but Consecutive to Walworth County case 13CF186.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.
*  Pay supervision fees.
Do not possess or consume alcoholic beverages and do not have alcoholic beverages within the residence.  Do not be in taverns or on any premises licensed for the sale of intoxicating beverages, except restaurants or grocery stores.  Do not possess or consume controlled substances, except by prescription.  Participate in counseling deemed appropriate by your agent, which may include: alcohol/drug, anger management/DV counseling, psychiatric/psychological, AODA Assessment and follow-through with recommended treatment.  Actively search for employment, be employed or attend an educational institution or vocational training program.  Obtain GED or H.S.E.D. during term of probation.
*  Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*  Defendant is ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice is given.
May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay prosecution costs of $1,143.00.

May not possess any weapons, including firearms.
*  Pay prosecution costs of $1,143.00.

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Atty. Colleen Marion appeared on behalf of the DE who was not present.  However, this is not an evidentiary hearing and his appearance is waived.  The Judge originally ordered that cts. 1 & 6 are concurrent to each other, but consecutive to Walworth county case 13CF186.  All repeaters and enhancers were dropped.  JOC to be amended to reflect the change.  Clerk D. Smith.

records.addlTxt: Conditions of extended supervision imposed by the Judge
Conditions of probation imposed by the Judge

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Defendant in custody and appeared in court w/ Attorney Van Cuick.  Clerk/S. Garcia.  Sentencing arguments heard.  On count 1, the court withhold sentence and places the defendant on probation for 7 years w/conditions, consecutive to count 6.  On count 6 the court imposes a total sentence of 4 years WSP; 2 years initial confinement and 2 years extended supervision w/conditions, consecutive to Walworth County Case 13CF186; 182 days credit.  DE is eligible for CIP/SAP.  DE is ordered to pay prosecution costs during probation/extended supervision. Defendant is ordered to submit a DNA sample and pay the cost; written notice provided to defendant.
from DE re: sentence

Attorney Rosa Delgado appeared for the State.  Def. appeared (in custody) with Atty Brenda VanCuick.  Clerk K. Zirbel.  Counts 2, 3, 4, and 5 - Dismissed, to be read in.  Counts 1 and 6 - Pleas of guilty; found guilty by the Court.  Presentence investigation ordered.  Sentencing 2/19/18 at 1:30.  Bond ordered revoked.
Per ADA Delgado & Atty. VanCuick the case is resolved.  Therefore, the DE will be entering a plea on 12/8/17 @ 11:00.
